com.yantra.interop.japi

Interface YIFRestartableApi


  • public interface YIFRestartableApi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document execute(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inDoc)
      This is the interface that the user needs to implement when creating extended APIs that need the restartability feature provided by the Interoperability Framework.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        org.w3c.dom.Document execute(YFSEnvironment env,
                             org.w3c.dom.Document inDoc)
                      throws ServiceSuspendException
        This is the interface that the user needs to implement when creating extended APIs that need the restartability feature provided by the Interoperability Framework. This interface is applicable for aynchronous transports only. The user can specify an extended an Api to be restartable.

        For example, the user may create an extended Api , say processMail that receives messages from a JMS Queue or a Database , and sends the received message to an SMTP server as an e-mail message. The user will create an extended Api called processMail, and configure the extended API in the Interoperability Framework to use a user-defined class. Under normal circumstances the user can specify any class which has an empty cosntructor, and implement a method which takes in a YFSEnvironment and a Document, and returns a Document. The Interoperability Framework will new up the user-defined class, and execute the user-defined method, passing in two input parameters to the user-defined method, namely a YFSEnvironment object, and the received message message as a Document object. However, consider the case when the user tries to send an e-mail message from his user-defined method, and the mail server is not available. The user might want to suspend processing all messages for a pre-configured time interval, and then retry after the time interval. In such a case, the user can implement this restartable interface, and throw a ServiceSuspendException when he realises that he cannot connect to the mail server.

        The Interoperability Framework will immediatley realises that the extended api has encountered a suspendable exception, and will rollback the current message from the the asynchronous medium, suspend all threads for the restartable time interval configured for that extended API, and resume normal processing after waiting for the pre-configured time interval.

        The user has to exercise discretion in throwing the ServiceSuspendException This exception should ideally be thrown only when the user code has encountered situations where an external system (such as mail server, or a credit card authorization server), and not for typical java exceptions. The restartability feature ensures that messages are never lost from the asynchronous message medium even when external systems are unreachable. env an YFSEnvironment value inDoc a Document value a Document value ServiceSuspendException if an error occurs It is not required to implement this interface to suspend a service. Custom api's can throw a ServiceSuspendException to suspend the service.

        Throws:
        ServiceSuspendException
